metadata.name: buttonVariants
metadata.description: A class-variance-authority (cva) configuration that defines the styling variants for the Button component. It includes base styles for the button and variants for different visual styles (default, destructive, outline, secondary, ghost, link) and sizes (default, sm, lg, icon). The function generates the appropriate className string based on the provided variant and size props.

metadata.name: ButtonProps
metadata.description: Interface extending React's button HTML attributes and variant props from the buttonVariants style configuration. It defines the type structure for the Button component's props, including variant, size, and asChild properties.

definition.name: Button
definition.description: A versatile button component that supports multiple variants and sizes. It can be rendered as a button element or as a child component using the asChild prop. The button includes styling for different states including hover, focus, and disabled states.

variant.description: The visual style variant of the button

asChild.description: When true, the button will be rendered as a Slot component, allowing it to be polymorphic

className.description: Additional CSS classes to apply to the button

definition.visualLayout: A button component that can be styled with different variants and sizes. It maintains consistent padding, border-radius, and typography while adapting its appearance based on the variant prop. Icons can be included with proper spacing and sizing.
